summary: Email correspondence between court officials regarding public access procedures for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, including COVID-19 protocols and coordination for victim attendance. The trial began with jury selection on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Edward Friedland
persons.context: Court official who forwarded outdated information about trial access and requested updates to the web page to reflect in-person attendance requirements.

persons.name: Jose Matthew Rogers
persons.context: Appears as a recipient/copied on email correspondence about trial access procedures.

persons.name: Joseph Pecorino
persons.context: Provided link to the Maxwell case page and is listed as a contact for victims wishing to attend the trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell) referenced throughout the document.

connections.description: Court officials coordinating on trial access procedures and website updates.
Pecorino's office is involved in coordinating victim access to Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell trial begins with jury selection
events.description: Trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell commenced with jury selection proceedings.

events.title: Court order on trial access procedures
events.description: S.D.N.Y. Court issued order outlining procedures for public access to the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Updated court order on trial access
events.description: S.D.N.Y. Court issued updated order on procedures for public access to the Maxwell trial.

locations: Southern District of New York (S.D.N.Y.) courthouse
United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Ghislaine Maxwell trial began with jury selection on November 29, 2021.
Public access to the trial was limited to in-person attendance with COVID-19 protocols, with no telephonic or broadcast access beyond courthouse live feeds.
Victim attendance was coordinated through the U.S. Attorney's Office Victim-Witness Coordinator and Joseph Pecorino of the Court's District Executive Office.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were enforced including temperature checks, masks, and health questionnaires for courthouse entry.
Court officials were correcting outdated web information that incorrectly suggested phone access to the trial.
